result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Robert Ewert in court. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defendant states the he did speak with an attorney yesterday. Seeking additional time. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Mr. Ewert stopped by traffic office seeking to adjourn the 8/2/2022 hearing. This clerk reached out the the State to see if there would be any objections to rescheduling. The State does object. Contacted Mr. Ewert via phone and spoke with him to notify him that his adjournment request is denied and he must appear in person for tomorrow's hearing. Verified time and location with Mr. Ewert.
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m. No contact with witness L.M
